chapter.title: Using Typeclasses
chapter.para: Typeclasses are one of the most powerful features in Haskell. They are also at the heart of some basic language features such as equality testing and numeric operators. Before we talk about what exactly typeclasses are, though, we'd like to first explain the need for them.

sect1.title: The need for typeclasses
sect1.para: Let's imaging that for some unfathomable reason, the designers of the Haskell language neglected to implement the equality test ==. Once you got over your shock at hearing this, you resolved to implement your own equality tests. Your program consisted of a simple Color type, and so your first equality test is for this type.
